explicit

Class MDPSimple

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.ModelExplicit
      • explicit.MDPExplicit
        • explicit.MDPSimple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDP, MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>, Model, ModelSimple, NondetModel, NondetModelSimple
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTMDPSimple, STPGExplicit

    public class MDPSimple
extends MDPExplicit
implements NondetModelSimple
    Simple explicit-state representation of an MDP. The implementation is far from optimal, both in terms of memory usage and speed of access. The model is, however, easy to manipulate. For a static model (i.e. one that does not change after creation), consider MDPSparse, which is more efficient.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface explicit.MDP

        MDP.TransitionConsumer, MDP.TransitionToDoubleFunction

      • MDPSimple

        public MDPSimple(MDPSimple mdp,
                 int[] permut)
        Construct an MDP from an existing one and a state index permutation, i.e. in which state index i becomes index permut[i]. Note: have to build new Distributions from scratch anyway to do this, so may as well provide this functionality as a constructor.

      • buildFromPrismExplicit

        public void buildFromPrismExplicit(java.lang.String filename)
                            throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: ModelExplicit
        Build (anew) from a list of transitions exported explicitly by PRISM (i.e. a .tra file). Note that initial states are not configured (since this info is not in the file), so this needs to be done separately (using ModelExplicit.addInitialState(int).
        Specified by:
        buildFromPrismExplicit in interface ModelSimple
        Specified by:
        buildFromPrismExplicit in class ModelExplicit
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • addChoice

        public int addChoice(int s,
                     Distribution distr)
        Add a choice (distribution distr) to state s (which must exist). Distribution is only actually added if it does not already exists for state s. (Assuming allowDupes flag is not enabled.) Returns the index of the (existing or newly added) distribution. Returns -1 in case of error.

      • addActionLabelledChoice

        public int addActionLabelledChoice(int s,
                                   Distribution distr,
                                   java.lang.Object action)
        Add a choice (distribution distr) labelled with action to state s (which must exist). Action/distribution is only actually added if it does not already exists for state s. (Assuming allowDupes flag is not enabled.) Returns the index of the (existing or newly added) distribution. Returns -1 in case of error.

      • setAction

        public void setAction(int s,
                      int i,
                      java.lang.Object o)
        Set the action label for choice i in some state s. This method does not know about duplicates (i.e. if setting an action causes two choices to be identical, one will not be removed). Use addActionLabelledChoice(int, Distribution, Object) which is more reliable.

      • getNumTransitions

        public int getNumTransitions()
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Get the total number of transitions in the model.
        Specified by:

      • findDeadlocks

        public void findDeadlocks(boolean fix)
                   throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Find all deadlock states and store this information in the model. If requested (if fix=true) and if needed (i.e. for DTMCs/CTMCs), fix deadlocks by adding self-loops in these states. The set of deadlocks (before any possible fixing) can be obtained from Model.getDeadlockStates().
        Specified by:
        findDeadlocks in interface Model
        Throws:
        PrismException - if the model is unable to fix deadlocks because it is non-mutable.

      • checkForDeadlocks

        public void checkForDeadlocks(java.util.BitSet except)
                       throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Checks for deadlocks and throws an exception if any exist. States in 'except' (If non-null) are excluded from the check.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • indexOfChoice

        public int indexOfChoice(int s,
                         Distribution distr)
        Returns the index of the choice distr for state s, if it exists. If none, -1 is returned. If there are multiple (i.e. allowDupes is true), the first is returned.

      • indexOfActionLabelledChoice

        public int indexOfActionLabelledChoice(int s,
                                       Distribution distr,
                                       java.lang.Object action)
        Returns the index of the action-labelled choice distr for state s, if it exists. If none, -1 is returned. If there are multiple (i.e. allowDupes is true), the first is returned.

      • mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle

        public double mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                              double[] vect,
                                              MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                              double discount,
                                              boolean min,
                                              int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + discount*(sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Specified by:
        mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle in interface MDP
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        discount - The discount factor (in (0,1])
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
